chapter.title: CMS Site Settings & Configurations
chapter.para: There are several areas that you can edit to change how the enrolment process works.

section.title: Contact Entry - Mandatory/Optional fields
section.para: You have the ability to choose whether an enrolment question is made mandatory, optional or hidden within the CMS by going to Site Setting -> Contact Entry. The first three questions 'First name', 'Last name' and 'Email' are set to Required as default and can't be changed.

The other questions will have a drop down next to them so you can choose whether that question is made mandatory, optional or hidden for the enrolment process, waiting list and mailing list. The three options in the drop down list are 'Show', 'Hide' and 'Required'.

caption.para: Choosing whether you want a question to be mandatory, optional or hidden during the online enrolment process

section.title: Custom Fields
section.para: Any custom fields created within the contact record of onCourse will be added to the list of questions that can be added to the online enrolment process, waiting list and mailing list. You will also be able to choose whether these questions are made mandatory, optional or hidden. They are set to 'Hide' as default.

caption.para: Where the custom fields created in onCourse will appear within the CMS

section.title: Minimum Age
section.para: There is also an option to only allow students enrolling online to be above a certain age. The age is set to 0 as default and can be changed at the bottom of the Contact Entry page within the CMS. Any age set in this field will only apply to classes where you have not specified a maximum or minimum age. For example, your global (CMS) preference may be 18, however you may also have some children's classes where you have set an age range of 5 to 12 years..

caption.para: The field where you can choose if there is a minimum age to enrol online

section.para: You also have an option to choose whether the student needs to provide additional details of their parent or guardian if they are below a certain age. The check box determines if the feature to be used at all, and the age field to specify when this feature will be activated.

caption.para: This feature allows you to choose whether a student requires them to provide a parent or guardians contact details if they below a certain age

section.title: skillsOnCourse Settings
section.para: On this tab you can select some configuration settings for your skillsOnCourse student, tutor and company portals.

section.title: Payment & Post Enrolment Questions
section.para: In the website tab, you have the option of setting up a page where the student gets re-directed to after they have finished with the online enrolment process.

Some users choose to create a page with additional form questions at this point, others may redirect to another internal page showing some marketing copy for deals to share with friends and colleagues.

To set which page you want them to be directed to, within the CMS, click on Site Settings -> Payment and make sure the checkbox is selected and the URL is entered in the field next to the text 'After payment successful redirect user to URL'

You also need to specify the page in the CMS which contains your enrolment/refund policy. This is the page students must click to agree they accept your conditions during the online enrolment process.

caption.para: Where you can choose what page you want a student to be directed to at the end of the online enrolment process
